\subsection{Detailed Description}
Class \hyperlink{class_date}{Date} 

\subsection{Constructor \& Destructor Documentation}
\hypertarget{class_date_a095c5d389db211932136b53f25f39685}{\index{Date@{Date}!\-\_\-\-\_\-construct@{\-\_\-\-\_\-construct}}
\index{\-\_\-\-\_\-construct@{\-\_\-\-\_\-construct}!Date@{Date}}
\subsubsection[{\-\_\-\-\_\-construct}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}\-\_\-\-\_\-construct (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{class_date_a095c5d389db211932136b53f25f39685}
C\-O\-N\-S\-T\-R\-U\-C\-T\-O\-R 4 optional ways of how this can be handled No arguments\-: in this case, the \hyperlink{class_date}{Date} instance corresponds to the current local date and time One argument, of type I\-N\-T\-: The argument is interpreted as a local timestamp in seconds One argument, of type S\-T\-R\-I\-N\-G\-: the argument is interpreted as a local date and time in R\-F\-C-\/1123 format Two-\/to-\/\-Six arguments, all of type I\-N\-T\-: handled similarly to the \hyperlink{class_date_ace4d1e8e89854ae12530593a9921f78f}{parse()} method, above
